info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 3:17PM CDT until September 21 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Coke.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, from just north of Robert Lee to Sanco to 3 miles northwest of Sanco. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robert Lee and Sanco. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Graham Valley crossing, Hurley crossing, Sanco crossing Yellow Wolf Creek and Grahan Valley crossing Messbox Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
